intro: Rudgea panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian rudgea, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Rudgea panamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
